Anyone up for some testing on a port?
https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/views_dependent_filters

backdrop-contrib/views_dependent_filters
Contribute to backdrop-contrib/views_dependent_filters development by creating an account on GitHub.

Sure, but I need instructions as I never used that module with D7. I played with a view with a dependent filter but - unless I totally misunderstand what it should do - it doesn't seem to work. Plus I get some php warnings/notices. screenshot-exposed.png

Ah, some more info: I figured out that a taxonomy term field exposed filter won't appear there, but, for instance, a node title does.

Update 2: no, not even the title appears reliably.
Thanks @indigoxela -- will respond later today!

@indigoxela Basically you need:

  1. An exposed filter above the Dependent Filter and an exposed filter underneath it.
  2. Then you can configure the Dependent Filter to use the one that is above as a "Controller" and the one that is beneath as a "Dependent".
  3. When the value of the Controller field matches what you've specified, the Dependent field should show, otherwise it should be hidden.

@Laryn Ah, got it, the order matters. But... the exposed filters still don't hide when they should.
Additionally I get:
Warning: implode(): Invalid arguments passed in form_error() (line 1744 of .../core/includes/form.inc). Notice: Undefined index: expose in views_handler_filter->expose_validate() (line 596 of .../core/modules/views/handlers/views_handler_filter.inc).

Will experiment more with that module when I find the time.
